issues.description: Method name mismatch for the Farm song method between the problem statement and the provided code. The problem statement and UML repeatedly refer to a public method named printFarmSong() (e.g., UML line for + printFarmSong():void and the explicit task text "Implement the method printFarmSong() inside Farm.java"). The template repository and the solution repository instead declare and use a method named singFarmSong() (public void singFarmSong()). This naming inconsistency can confuse students about which method to implement and will cause tests or the provided Main() to call a different method name than the one requested in the instructions.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the method name consistent across all artifacts. Either (a) update the problem statement (UML and task text) to refer to singFarmSong() instead of printFarmSong(), or (b) rename the method in the template and solution from singFarmSong() to printFarmSong() (and ensure Main/tests call printFarmSong()). Alternatively, provide a small note in the template indicating the intended method name if both names should be accepted (e.g., implement printFarmSong() and call singFarmSong() from it or vice versa).

issues.description: The problem statement asks students to implement a method named printFarmSong() (UML and Part 3 description), while both the template and the provided solution use the method name singFarmSong() for the same functionality. This naming mismatch can confuse students: they may look for a printFarmSong() stub in the template (or attempt to call printFarmSong() from tests/main) but only find singFarmSong(), or conversely implement printFarmSong() while the template expects singFarmSong().
issues.suggested_fix: Make the method name consistent across artifacts. Easiest fix: update the problem statement (UML and textual tasks) to refer to singFarmSong() instead of printFarmSong(). Alternatively, add a printFarmSong() wrapper in the template/solution that delegates to singFarmSong(), or rename singFarmSong() in template and solution to printFarmSong() so all artifacts use the same identifier.
